de.eckhartarnold.client

Class Compatibility

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.eckhartarnold.client.Compatibility

  • public class Compatibility
extends java.lang.Object
    Compatibility layer to evade a bug or feature (?) of the Internet Explorer Browser.

    • Field Summary

      Fields

    • Method Detail

      • fireLoadOnIE

        public static void fireLoadOnIE(Image img,
                java.lang.String url,
                LoadHandler handler)
        Fires the onLoad events of the LoadListeners manually in case the browser used is the MS Internet Explorer. This workaround is necessary, because the Internet Explorer sometimes omits to fire onLoadevents.

        ieFireLoad should be called after the Image.setUrl() method has been called if the image was not created with a specific URL already.

        Parameters:
        img - the image for which the LoadListeners are to be notified of the image's being loaded.
        url - the URL of the image. This is needed to keep trace of the image that IE (supposedly) has cached.
        handler - a LoadHandler to be notified or null
